intro: Galium rubrum var. leyboldii, commonly known as the Leybold's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive yet often overlooked member of the flora in its native habitats.
